Ideas: Instead of choosing a preferred enemy, you just get a bonus after killing an enemy type
Description: You are a hunter, tracker, always on your toes. No matter your foe, be it a beast, a vampire or a dragon, you know best how to deal with it.
Language: If your Intelligence is at least 1, choose one extra language you can speak that's either Common (Dwarvish, Elvish) or Wild (Orcish, Goblan, Sylvan, etc).
Weapons: Choose a Weapon category (1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc) and get Training in it.
Feats: You start with one Feat of choice.

~Proficiency in Hearing~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for hearing (e.g. over-hearing dialogue, noticing unusual sounds, discerning sounds, etc).

~Proficiency in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for sensing smells and identifying things based on their smell.

~Proficiency in Sight~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for seeing (e.g. noticing things in darkness, seeing far away objects, recognizing faces, etc).

~Proficiency in Animal Handling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for catching, subduing or tracking animals and understanding their behavior and intentions.

~Proficiency in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom and Intelligence Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.

~Proficiency in Monstrology~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for identifying monsters and Units and knowing what they do and how they behave.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells (not Talents) when taking a Long Rest.
Spellcasting.Other: All Hunter-specific Abilities are not considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).

~Slay~.Effect:
You always know the type of a monster.
You gain a different bonus when fighting an enemy of a certain type:
Monstrosities: Attacks against Monstrosities ignore half of the Defense.
Beasts: You have +1 Defense and +1 to all Combat Checks against Beasts.
Fiends: Your attacks against Fiends ignore damage resistances (but not immunities).
Undead: You have +2 Counter Check Grade against Undead.

~Tumble~.Effect: Move 1 meter in any direction, without triggering attacks of oportunity.

Starting Abilities Description.Slay and Tumble: You have various different bonuses when fighting certain types of enemies. If unsure about the type of a monster, ask the DM.

Starting Abilities Description.Tumble: Generally, when you move outside of a monster's attack range, it can make a free attack on you. Tumble allows you to reposition so that you can easily exit that zone.

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization.
Choices: Draven, a tracker and hunter of beats and men, never lost and never without purpose
Warden, a potent user of fast and practical magic to use against foes, and with allies
Beastmaster, a pack hunter, who finds friends in even the most ruthless of beasts

~Tracker~.Effect:
o You can more easily track creatures.
When you try to track a creature, your roll for that try gains +3.
If you succeed, you may learn about its size, how many of them there are, if it's injured or roughly how far away it is.
o Your party can't get lost in the wild except by magical means
o You (and your pets) are unaffected by Difficult Terrain.

~Hunter Mark~.Effect:
Choose and mark a target.
Your own single target attacks (against Defense) against the marked target have the damage dice increased by 1 tier.
Last up to 10 minutes.
~Hunter Mark~.Notes:
Increasing dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d8, or d10 become d12.
D12's don't increase.
Your pets' attacks don't increase.

<Flare Shot>.Effect:
Quickly shoot a flare at a target point.
The area around the flare lights up in a 6 meter radius, creating normal light.
When cast, all allies in the area are cleared of Stun, Fear or Cripple.
Allies in the area have Advantage on rolls against Fear.
The flare lasts 1 minute.
<Flare Shot>.Notes: But seriously, get the Animal Companion. Why would you even pick this?

<Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you!
Your animal has stats depending on its species.
By default, apply the following stats to your pet (these will get modified by your pet's species):
- Movement: 5 meters
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
Pets can't make Opportunity Attacks.

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 + 2 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce damage, up to 7 meters.
For each meter to the target over 7 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 7 meters range, the attack deals 7d6 damage. At 6 and 8 meters, it deals 6d6. At 4 and 9 meters, 5d6. And so on.

<Running Mark>.Effect:
You can use Tumble one more time per Long Rest.
Immediately after you Tumble, you can freely use Hunter Mark, ignoring its Cooldown.

<Tremor Wave>.Effect:
Shoot a thundering shot towards an obstacle or wall. A quaking wave travels horizontally towards in both directions of the wall up to 10 meters in each direction.
All Units within 2 meters of that wall must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 4d4 Shock damage.
They take half the damage and are Slowed if they pass.
<Tremor Wave>.Notes: The floor and ceiling are not considered a wall. The wave does not travel through them. This is considered a Spell.

~Warden~.Effect:
Your Spellcasting type becomes Mana-based instead of Insight-based.
You have a number of Mana points equal to 3 + Your Level.
You also permanently choose to know 2 more Spells from the Elemental, Divine and Arcane spells list.
~Warden~.Notes: These 2 Spells can be changed on Long Rests.

~Quick Magic~.Effect:
Spend any amount of Mana.
Choose one of the following effects, then apply the exact same effect for each Mana spent:
- Instantly deal 1d6 Fire, Frost or Shock damage to a target, and permanently reduce its Defense by 1 (3 meter range).
- Instantly heal a target for 1d6 (3 meter range).
- Instantly dash 3 meters, ignoring attacks of oportunity, and going through enemies and small obstacles or medium gaps.

Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.

The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 + 2 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Watcher Form>.Effect:
You take on a special form, called a Watcher Form.
Your body becomes engulfed in a magical aura (you choose its color), your eyes glow, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations (customize it with your DM).
While in this form, your first Attack deals +1d8 damage once per turn, you gain +2 Counter Check Grade and +2 to all Combat Checks.
Also, when you cast a spell (before you do; excluding this), you can instantly dash 3 meters, ignoring attacks of oportunity, and going through enemies and small obstacles or medium gaps.
Lasts up to 1 minute.

<Combo Set>.Effect: You gain Quickfire, Parry and Tumblestrike.

<Quickfire (Hunter)>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed weapon.
This attack ignores Cover and has no pentaly if you're Blinded.
This attack does not trigger attacks of oportunity and can be used in melee range without penalty if it's a ranged weapon.

<Parry>.Effect: When a Unit declares a melee attack with a weapon on you (before you see the roll), you can block this attack and it deals 0 damage.

<Tumblestrike>.Effect: After you Tumble or Parry, your next Attack has the dice tiers increased.
<Tumblestrike>.Notes:
For example, instead of 2d6, an attack would be 2d8.
D12's don't increase, they stay d12.
This only affects Attacks. If an Ability tells you to Attack, then it applies.
For example, Quick Magic is not an attack.

<Warden Corral>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter zone.
All Units have their Defense quartered (25%) while in that zone.
The zone lasts until the start of your next turn.

<Wind Wall>.Effect:
Use when an enemy or enemy group declares an attack.
Create a 4x4 meter wall of powerful Wind that destroys all projectiles.
It can't be passed through from the direction it is facing towards.
Lasts for 1 minute.
<Wind Wall>.Notes:
The wall pushes objects or willing Units away from it and can be used as a platform.
If you decide to place it horizontally, it acts as Hard Terrain.

<Improved Slay>.Effect:
Your Slay bonuses against enemies improve and are now the following:
Monstrosities: Attacks against Monstrosities ignore 75% of the Defense.
Beasts: You have +2 Defense and +2 to all Combat Checks against Beasts.
Fiends: Your attacks against Fiends ignore damage resistances and immunities.
Undead: You have +3 Counter Check Grade against Undead.

<Second Companion>.Effect:
You have one more Animal Companion, aside from the one you get from your Beastmaster Companion.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one.

<Exotic Trainer>.Effect: Instead of your normal pets, you can choose from the Exotic list of pets.

<Ravage!>.Effect:
Your pet makes a melee Attack for 4d8 Slash damage.
Deals Main Stat extra damage if the target is below 50% Health.
The target can't regain Health until the end of combat
<Ravage!>.Notes: This takes 1 Action from YOU, not your pet.

<Sickem>.Effect:
Use when a Unit goes flying against its will.
Your pet(s) within 5 meters of its landing place can dash to it (after it lands) and make a total of 3 Pet Attacks on it.
Pets don't provoke Opportunity Attacks when dashing like this.
<Sickem>.Notes:
Goes flying means is pushed, knocked up, dragged, etc.
This uses YOUR Reaction, not your pets'.
Obviously, the pets need line of sight and can't jump through walls, or over large obstacles. Apply common sense.
